metadata.Title: CVE-2017-7526 on Ubuntu 16.04 LTS (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
libgcrypt before version 1.7.8 is vulnerable to a cache side-channel attackresulting into a complete break of RSA-1024 while using the left-to-rightmethod for computing the sliding-window expansion. The same attack isbelieved to work on RSA-2048 with moderately more computation. Thisside-channel requires that attacker can run arbitrary software on thehardware where the private RSA key is used.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7526` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libgcrypt20 - 1.6.5-2ubuntu0.3
No subscription required

gnupg - 1.4.20-1ubuntu3.3
gnupg-curl - 1.4.20-1ubuntu3.3
gpgv - 1.4.20-1ubuntu3.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libgcrypt20 package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.6.5-2ubuntu0.3').
gnupg package in xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.4.20-1ubuntu3.3').
